title: I main support, and...
body:
1) You don't get to pick my champion. Need a tank, top/jg can pick a tank instead of playing their glass cannon.
2) You don't get to select my items.
3) The ADC doesn't own me, I can wander to help other lanes. If I'm gone, play safe. 
4) If you're dead, it's most likely your fault, play better don't blame me.

replies.body:
1. If the top and jungler had pick priority and they have both picked non-tanks, be a team player and pick a tank. If you the top/jungler is picking after you, they should do the same.

2. If you don't have a key item that the team needs they we have every right to suggest you get that item. Same as you have the right to suggest items to us if we over look something.

3. Agreed. You're a support from the team, not the ADC's bodyguard. 

4. Pretty much. 

Had to nitpick at 1 and 2 slightly :P

not knocking your comment, im just curious who gets to decide on #2 though.... what is a "key item", wont it depend... do we talk about our ranks, throw down our epeens?

while im sure many suggestions are trying to be helpful when people tell others to build something or some way or even pick a certain champ, most times in a text environment, this one in lol in particular, it comes across really rude

yes, we can all suggest things, the op posted this though because it does not often come across as nice when people do... and if the support dares to not build that item, the next thing to be heard is how the support is losing the game for the team

Well, let's just take one scenario of the many infinite that could occur.

The enemy team is heavily AD focused and mostly autoattack based. You're playing Leona.
You have overlooked the purchase of a Frozen Heart for some reason. Your top laner is already in the process of building his next core item. And your Jungler wont benefit directly from the mana because it's a Rek'Sai. So, a simple 'Hey Leona, we could really do with a FH, they are mostly AD autoattackers' isn't harmful, it's merely suggestive.

Like I say, that's one scenario out of an infinte number. Sure, it can come across rude if it's not put across politely or if it's said as a direct instruction. But if it's said politely and suggestively, then there's no harm done.
I'm having a hard time thinking of any situation where a support COULDN'T benefit from getting {{item:3050}}, at least after boot, the gp5 item, and a sightstone.

zeke's in a nice item, 
but in all honesty it disappoints me.
the power-up is too uncontrolled for me, 
i feel like i don't have any control over when i get to power-up or against which opponent. 

basically the power is invisible which sucks, for me.
I like getting it on Veigar. People don't normally agree, but the activated component gives ***20%*** AP. Since he tends to have a lot late game, it can be a monstrous team-fight steroid.
What would you replace to get it, though?

"Replace"?
Implying that I ever have a 1-size-fits-all build to begin with.

As per my previous comment, I disagree that Mikael's or Zeke's are "key items" that a team can reasonably ask you to build. They only buff one person and don't have a team-wide effect, it's up to you to decide if you want them or not. And as for Frozen Heart, it's definitely a key item, but if the enemy Top is the only AS-based champ, your Top shouldn't force you to build it just because he lost his lane.

A "key item" in this context is obviously an item that has a team-wide effect. An Executioner Calling, an Aegis, a Frozen Heart, a Sightstone, something like that. ZZ'rot and Banner of Command to some extent. An item that changes the way the whole team's strategy and capacity to fight. And usually, there isn't really any doubt about when such an item is needed, so "who decides" isn't often a relevant question.

It is called communication, if our Support only plays squishy supports, they won't pick a tanky support because they can't play them well. Just ask, hey can you play a tanky support? If not then you pick a tank (supposing you are Top/Jg).   

If i am a Support main, trust my judgement on what items I am buying. I am not always right, but the main thing is i am building them because i believe they are the right thing to buy. If you are a higher ranked Support main, by all means suggest items for me, but for the most part I build what I think the team needs, not what the team wants.  

I think we can all agree with this point :)  

Same with this one, if the ADC dies they made a mistake, end of story. Same as if anyone dies.

Supports aren't the greatest tanks, though. It's composition suicide to have glass cannons everywhere and force the lowest income role to be a tank. Come mid-game, you either win the teamfights or you don't and there's no coming back from it since the support can't get the items they need to tank.
Don't depend on your support to tank. They have NO INCOME to allow them to ever truly tank more then a few hits.

1. It's pretty dangerous to assume that the support player can play tanks well, as this isn't always the case. That's why Pick Intent is a thing, and why you have a window in Champ Select to check what players can/cannot comfortably play. Whether or not they *should* learn to play tanks before going into Ranked is a different horse to beat. 

2. I was under the impression that OP wasn't talking about "friendly suggestions" as that can be said for any lane, but rather players that demand you buy an item and berate/flame/troll you should you disagree or build differently.

Just nitpicking nitpicking. :3

1. No one was assuming anything, and we have all agreed that communication is of the utmost importance. However, in a situation where you are lower in the pick order than your top and jungler and your team is in need of a tank, be a team player and play a tank. Unless you are an insanely good utility support.

2. This is a conversation we have been having in the thread. Friendly suggestions never killed anyone, so long as they are put across in such a way that can't easily be miscontrued as a demand/dictatation.

Regardless of pick order, forcing someone to play a tank when it's not a role they can comfortably can result in an even worse situation than had they just played what they know and were comfortable with. Often times, people who take this advice and play something they're not good with or used to ends up with them being berated for poor performance by the very same people that coerced them into making the selection.

The assertion that someone should "Be a team player and play a tank" assumes that they can play a tank, which isn't always the case.
This thread basically summarizes why i hate supporting. All these toxic carries think they know better than you how to play you role or  your champion. Sad thing that support is my main role.
I don't give a flying skarl if you go AP  {{champion:12}} just get a sightstone.

> [{quoted}](name=Knoyle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=p4Vd7BGK,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2016-07-28T14:43:16.464+0000)
>
> I don't give a flying skarl if you [...]

D...Did you just memed?

if i'm first pick, i'll play what i please.

if I'm latter in the draft, I'll pick what the team needs.

You're under the same obligation as top and jungle to pick what suits the team. And, unfortunately, those top and junglers are thinking the same thing. That you and the other role capable of picking tankier options should do it instead of them. If all three of you can't communicate enough to get even one initiator champion then you're all just plain bad and you can't pin it on top/jg exclusively.

I'll agree with you on the items thing, I've had SS-less supports do more work and ward more than ones I've had with SS. If you're getting the job done then you can do it how you want.

They don't own you but they still rely on you. If you don't give them warning about when you're roaming, you're very much at fault for them being 2v1'd. When you show your face mid they will go for your ADC, even under tower if they're able. And if you haven't communicated to your ADC that you are leaving...you're a bad support. :\ That's just how that is.

My personal fave is when the rest of the team has taken:
no hard CC
no AP
no tank

And they expect you to actually fill all that as the supp.

Thankfully I enjoy playing support tanks, because 90% of the time it's Yasuo top, Zed mid, an assassin jungle and the ADC.
When everyone's gone AD and there's no tanks besides me? That's when I get a bit grumpy.

1) isn't exactly true... If you say that, why couldn't the other 2 say the exact same thing? And then the team has no Tank at all. There need to be a dialogue, you can't just say "You don't get to pick my champ." But on the other hand, a dialogue isn't "dumb sup, take a fuckin' Tank", either.
2) I 99% agree, with the reservation that if you make something obviously stupid, I'll suggest something better, just like for any other role, that's not specific to support. If you don't take a Sighstone, I'll politely ask you to do it. And if you still don't do it, I'll report you for lack of communication in the end. If you have already 3 full items and no Aegis, and they have 3 AP in their team, I'll ask you to buy one ASAP. The same way I'll ask an ADC to build en Executioner Calling if they have Mundo Vlad and Swain.
3) again 99% agree, but there are also wrong times to wander to help other lanes, and maybe the ADC is right to complain. Best thing to do is to ping and communicate what you plan to do before actually doing it.
4) Mostly agree, but in a 2v2 fight, the one dead isn't necessarily the one that made a mistake. How often do you willingly sacrifice in order to save your ADC when HE did a mistake and you did nothing wrong? Still you're dead, he's not. Should you really "play better" and say nothing to him? Well, sometimes he can be dead because you made a mistake too, and *blaming* you is not helpful, but talking about it sure would help you improve too.
I've had multiple games where I have told the adc to build executioners and they haven't so why do I have to build a sightstone

Because you want to win? You made the suggestion to the ADC because it was the proper thing to do in order to win the game, and building the Sightstone is also the proper thing to do to win the game.

You don't get a right to be dumb if other people are dumb, and even if you had that right, why would you want to use it? Just to lose the game?
Late game supports sell their sightstone anyways so I don't even bother to build it.  Aegis and ardent are much more useful than silly vision
3 wards is not enough vision and it's not solely the supports job. 5 wards one from every teammate is much more useful

Are you for real? Provide me a replay from a Plat+ game where a Support sold back his Sightstone in late game.

Let's not talk about the fact that your team should have switched to Red and Blue Trinkets by then, so you don't even have 5 wards...

I love when i get support and i hover over Janna or Zyra or Morgana, and the toplaner and jungler on my team decide to pick kha'zix and riven then tell me i need to play Leona or Braum so we have a tank. like are you forreal i just hovered over janna for the full duration of this champ select and you didnt say nothin.

as someone who plays morg support i would like this throw this in...

Just because you have a  {{champion:25}} on your team doesn't mean you are suddenly immune to CC all game. it has a cooldown.. it has a range. and when you go in like an idiot when i am not expecting you to do something so stupid, i may not always land the spellshield in time to get your ass out of there before you get yourself killed
5.) It is not my responsibility to have 100% of the wards on the map, you have to ward too
^^This

Whenever I play Fiora top I try my best to ward river bush and keep it warded all the time.

You have no idea how many times (in one game at that) I was saved by a pink ward at river from an ulting Rengar

Supports are fking amazing man you guys make the entire team look good I love you guys. When I'm jungler sometimes I give blue to the supports fk mid. People keep telling me mid will make better use of blue but they make me regret my decision quite often (they think with blue they're gods for some reason and ending up giving blue to the other team going 1vs5). However everytime I give blue to the supports we freakin win and win hard. They make great use and full advantage of it. Not to mention it helps them better at keeping the ADCs alive. I never regret it. 

Yo supports ily yall lit af

Next time I play support I'm going to remember this thread and do everything it says but in reverse just to see how it goes. "buy wits end adc it really helps my damage" "adc you should pick a marksmen with AP since it benefits more from my magic debuff" "don't leave me adc wtf. Dragon didn't need you. I needed you. How am I supposed to take tower without you?" "stupid adc didn't buy bloodthirster first. What an idiot. GG everyone GG. Adc went critical and penetration. No damage or sustain. Can't take a single Q from nidalee GG!"

However are you actually going to pick a real support or are you lowkey trying to apc. I see that so often and it pisses me off because supports are very important to a team. We don't need an sub-par midlaner bot.

I hate playing tank supports, they scale so slow. Top and jg tanks are usually more efficient. Supports really need to be playing caster play-maker types *most* the time. Ali, Naut, and Braum work OK as they both scale off health well and Blitz and Tresh are good cheese picks if you're good with them. Leo will always be a sad girl until she gets some kind of health scaling or earlier armor items that don't stray her too far from supp tank items. 

Usually though if you want peel just play a caster with disengage and you don't have to worry about trying to tank a fed enemy carry while being 2 levels and 5000 gold behind.

1. If the other picks get to pick any champ they want to play so does the support. Once again the team is being selfish and expecting the support to pick of the slack or be blamed for it. Its everyone's responsibility to pick a proper team comp, whatever it may be. This is a **TEAM GAME.** 
2. It is everyone's responsibility to provide vision. NO ONE IS SPECIAL IN THIS REGARD. Ideally laners are responsible for their lanes and near by objectives. Jungler is to help warding objectives and vital camps.
3.  A support has a limited income with not taking cs from the cry baby adc or kills from the team. A support only has 3 free item slots to get items after {{item:1001}} {{item:2049}} {{item:3092}} *or other gold income item*. Typically I expect a support to be able to get a {{item:3190}} {{item:3060}} or {{item:3143}} {{item:3110}} but not all. Everyone needs to build for /against the enemy team comps. 
4. THIS IS A TEAM GAME, I AM NO ONES BITCH! We win as a team its my job as a support to support the team. This means if i wonder to mid to secure a turret the damn ADC needs to use their {{item:3361}} and be safe. 
5. Respect your support the reason why you won lane and carried the game just might be them and not you. its not like they dont have 22 asst by afking in base. 
6. I am not your safety net for being stupid. Make smart decisions. Mistakes happen we all do it, yes i got caught and died 1 vs 3 TRYING TO WARD! 
7. Realize if I get in the way and become a human meat shield so your squishy out of position ass dont die and I sacrifice my life for yours dont flame me. I could of let you die which would lead in you have less experience , items, gold. I could be robot nunu and spam laugh when you die. 
8. I know i cant win the game with out you and but chances are you wont carry with me and think you are a god as league of legends.

Actually I play legitimate support  champs with every intention of supporting the team, including tanks.

But if you pick 4 glass cannons and expect me to tank, that's not happening.
I will just get deleted, and then the team will cry that I'm such a bad tank.
Nami or Lulu for instance have enough utility to disrupt in team fights, heal, and poke.

One thing i learned new in this season. If i take a tank toplane like my team tells me to do, I won't be able to deal with that monster carry they fed the whole game. Nothing deals with a fed carry better than {{champion:41}}  :d

You would have the gold supply to do so.
Think about the gold earned by top/jg and compare that to sup.

The support is best played as a utility position. Even if the support ends up tanking, there needs to be utility coming out of top and JG as well. Four glass cannons and a support tank don't win the game. Even in sup goes tank, the the jg or top still has to use a utility champ with some hard CC and the other another tanky champ. Not another glass cannon...
